topics.name: 1. Basic economic ideas and resource allocation

subtopics.name: 1.1 Scarcity, choice and opportunity cost
details: fundamental economic problem of scarcity
need to make choices at all levels (individuals, firms, governments)
nature and definition of opportunity cost, arising from choices
basic questions of resource allocation: what to produce, how to produce, for whom to produce

subtopics.name: 1.2 Economic methodology
details: economics as a social science
positive and normative statements (the distinction between facts and value judgements)
meaning of the term ceteris paribus
importance of the time period (short run, long run, very long run)

subtopics.name: 1.3 Factors of production
details: nature and definition of factors of production: land, labour, capital and enterprise
difference between human capital and physical capital
rewards to the factors of production
division of labour and specialisation
role of the entrepreneur in contemporary economies: risk and organisation of the other factors of production

subtopics.name: 1.4 Resource allocation in different economic systems
details: decision-making in market, planned and mixed economies
resource allocation in these economic systems

subtopics.name: 1.5 Production possibility curves
details: nature and meaning of a production possibility curve (PPC)
shape of the PPC: constant and increasing opportunity costs
causes and consequences of shifts in a PPC
significance of a position within a PPC

subtopics.name: 1.6 Classification of goods and services
details: nature and definition of free goods and private goods (economic goods)
nature and definition of public goods
nature and definition of merit goods: under-consumption as a result of imperfect information in the market
nature and definition of demerit goods: over-consumption as a result of imperfect information in the market

topics.name: 2. The price system and the microeconomy

subtopics.name: 2.1 Demand and supply curves
details: effective demand
individual and market demand and supply
determinants of demand
determinants of supply
causes of a shift in the demand curve (D)
causes of a shift in the supply curve (S)
distinction between the shift in the demand or supply curve and the movement along these curves

subtopics.name: 2.2 Price elasticity, income elasticity and cross elasticity of demand
details: definition of price elasticity, income elasticity and cross elasticity of demand (PED, YED, XED)
formulae for and calculation of price elasticity, income elasticity and cross elasticity of demand
significance of relative percentage changes, the size and sign of the coefficient
descriptions of elasticity values: perfectly elastic, (highly) elastic, unitary elasticity, (highly) inelastic, perfectly inelastic
variation in price elasticity of demand along the length of a straight-line demand curve
factors affecting PED, YED, XED
relationship between price elasticity of demand and total expenditure on a product
implications for decision-making of PED, YED and XED

subtopics.name: 2.3 Price elasticity of supply
details: definition of price elasticity of supply (PES)
formula for and calculation of price elasticity of supply
significance of relative percentage changes, the size and sign of the coefficient of price elasticity of supply
factors affecting price elasticity of supply
implications for speed and ease with which firms react to changed market conditions

subtopics.name: 2.4 The interaction of demand and supply
details: definition of market equilibrium and disequilibrium
effects of shifts in demand and supply curves on equilibrium price and quantity
relationships between different markets: joint demand (complements), alternative demand (substitutes), derived demand, joint supply
functions of price in resource allocation; rationing, signalling (transmission of preferences) and incentivising

subtopics.name: 2.5 Consumer and producer surplus
details: meaning and significance of consumer surplus
meaning and significance of producer surplus
causes of changes in consumer and producer surplus
significance of price elasticity of demand and of supply in determining the extent of these changes

subtopics.name: 3.1 Reasons for government intervention in markets
details: addressing the non-provision of public goods
addressing the over-consumption of demerit goods and the under-consumption of merit goods
controlling prices in markets

subtopics.name: 3.2 Methods and effects of government intervention in markets
details: impact and incidence of specific indirect taxes
impact and incidence of subsidies
direct provision of goods and services
maximum and minimum prices
buffer stock schemes
provision of information

subtopics.name: 3.3 Addressing income and wealth inequality
details: difference between income as a flow concept and wealth as a stock concept
measuring income and wealth inequality: Gini coefficient (calculation not required)
economic reasons for inequality of income and wealth
policies to redistribute income and wealth: minimum wage, transfer payments, progressive income taxes, inheritance and capital taxes, state provision of essential goods and services

subtopics.name: 4.1 National income statistics
details: meaning of national income
measurement of national income: Gross Domestic Product (GDP), Gross National Income (GNI), Net National Income (NNI)
adjustment of measures from market prices to basic prices
adjustment of measures from gross values to net values

subtopics.name: 4.2 Introduction to the circular flow of income
details: circular flow of income in a closed economy and an open economy
injections and leakages (multiplier not required)
equilibrium and disequilibrium

subtopics.name: 4.3 Aggregate Demand and Aggregate Supply analysis
details: definition of Aggregate Demand (AD)
components of AD and their meanings: AD = C + I + G + (X – M)
determinants of AD
shape of the AD curve (downward sloping)
causes of a shift in the AD curve
definition of Aggregate Supply (AS)
determinants of AS
shape of the AS curve in the short run (SRAS) and the long run (LRAS)
causes of a shift in the AS curve in the short run (SRAS) and in the long run (LRAS)
distinction between a movement along and a shift in AD and AS
establishment of equilibrium in the AD/AS model
effects of shifts in the AD curve and the AS curve on the level of real output, the price level and employment

subtopics.name: 4.4 Economic growth
details: meaning of economic growth
measurement of economic growth
distinction between growth in nominal GDP and real GDP
causes of economic growth
consequences of economic growth

subtopics.name: 4.5 Unemployment
details: meaning of unemployment
measures of unemployment, with reference to possible difficulties in measurement
causes and types of unemployment: frictional, structural, cyclical, seasonal and technological
consequences of unemployment

subtopics.name: 4.6 Price stability
details: definition of inflation, deflation and disinflation
measurement of changes in the price level: consumer price index (CPI)
distinction between money values (nominal) and real data
causes of inflation: cost-push and demand-pull inflation
consequences of inflation

subtopics.name: 5.1 Government macroeconomic policy objectives
details: use of government policy to achieve macroeconomic objectives: price stability, low unemployment, economic growth

subtopics.name: 5.2 Fiscal policy
details: meaning of government budget
distinction between a government budget deficit and a government budget surplus
meaning and significance of the national debt
taxation: types of taxes, rates of tax, reasons for taxation
government spending: types of spending, reasons for government spending
distinction between expansionary and contractionary fiscal policy
AD/AS analysis of the impact of expansionary and contractionary fiscal policy

subtopics.name: 5.3 Monetary policy
details: definition of monetary policy
tools of monetary policy: interest rates, money supply and credit regulations
distinction between expansionary and contractionary monetary policy
AD/AS analysis of the impact of expansionary and contractionary monetary policy

subtopics.name: 5.4 Supply-side policy
details: meaning of supply-side policy, in terms of its effect on LRAS curves
objectives of supply-side policy: increasing productivity and productive capacity
tools of supply-side policy
AD/AS analysis of the impact of supply-side policy

subtopics.name: 6.1 The reasons for international trade
details: distinction between absolute and comparative advantage
benefits of specialisation and free trade (trade liberalisation)
exports, imports and the terms of trade: measurement, causes of changes, impact of changes
limitations of the theories of absolute and comparative advantage

subtopics.name: 6.2 Protectionism
details: meaning of protectionism in the context of international trade
different tools of protection and their impact: tariffs, import quotas, export subsidies, embargoes, excessive administrative burdens
arguments for and against protectionism

subtopics.name: 6.3 Current account of the balance of payments
details: components of the current account: trade in goods, services, primary and secondary income
calculation of trade balances and current account balance (CAB)
causes of imbalances in the current account
consequences of imbalances in the current account

subtopics.name: 6.4 Exchange rates
details: definition of exchange rate
determination of a floating exchange rate
distinction between depreciation and appreciation
causes of changes in a floating exchange rate: demand and supply of the currency
AD/AS analysis of the impact of exchange rate changes

subtopics.name: 6.5 Policies to correct imbalances in the current account
details: government policy objective of stability of the current account
effect of fiscal, monetary, supply-side and protectionist policies on the current account

topics.name: 7. The price system and the microeconomy

subtopics.name: 7.1 Utility
details: definition and calculation of total utility and marginal utility
diminishing marginal utility
equi-marginal principle
derivation of an individual demand curve
limitations of marginal utility theory and its assumptions of rational behaviour

subtopics.name: 7.2 Indifference curves and budget lines
details: meaning of an indifference curve and a budget line
causes of a shift in the budget line
income, substitution and price effects for normal, inferior and Giffen goods
limitations of the model of indifference curves

subtopics.name: 7.3 Efficiency and market failure
details: definitions of productive efficiency and allocative efficiency
conditions for productive efficiency and allocative efficiency
Pareto optimality
definition of dynamic efficiency
definition of market failure
reasons for market failure

subtopics.name: 7.4 Private costs and benefits, externalities and social costs and benefits
details: definition and calculation of social costs (SC), private costs (PC), external costs (EC)
definition and calculation of social benefits (SB), private benefits (PB), external benefits (EB)
definition of positive externality and negative externality
positive and negative externalities of both consumption and production
deadweight welfare losses arising from positive and negative externalities
asymmetric information and moral hazard
use of costs and benefits in analysing decisions

subtopics.name: 7.5 Types of cost, revenue and profit, short-run and long-run production
details: short-run production function: fixed/variable factors, calculation of products, law of diminishing returns
short-run cost function: fixed/variable costs, calculation of costs, shape of curves
long-run production function: no fixed factors, returns to scale
long-run cost function: shape of LRAC curve, concept of minimum efficient scale
relationship between economies of scale and decreasing average costs
internal and external economies of scale
internal and external diseconomies of scale
definition and calculation of revenue: total, average and marginal revenue (TR, AR, MR)
definition of normal, subnormal and supernormal profit
calculation of supernormal and subnormal profit

subtopics.name: 7.6 Different market structures
details: perfect competition and imperfect competition: monopoly, monopolistic competition, oligopoly, natural monopoly
structure based on buyers/sellers, differentiation, entry freedom, and information
barriers to entry and exit: legal, market, cost, and physical barriers
performance of firms: revenues, output, profits, shutdown price, efficiency/X-inefficiency, contestable markets, price/non-price competition
definition and calculation of the concentration ratio

subtopics.name: 7.7 Growth and survival of firms
details: reasons for different sizes of firms
internal growth: organic and diversification
external growth: horizontal, vertical (forwards/backwards), conglomerate integration; reasons and consequences
cartels: conditions and consequences
principal–agent problem

subtopics.name: 7.8 Differing objectives and policies of firms
details: profit-maximising objective
other objectives: survival, profit satisficing, sales maximisation, revenue maximisation
price discrimination: degrees, conditions, and consequences
other pricing policies: limit pricing, predatory pricing, price leadership
relationship between PED and revenue: normal vs kinked demand curves

subtopics.name: 8.1 Government policies to achieve efficient resource allocation and correct market failure
details: measures: taxes, subsidies, price controls, quotas, prohibitions, licenses, regulation/deregulation, direct provision, pollution permits, property rights, nationalisation/privatisation, information, nudge theory
government failure: definition, causes, and consequences

subtopics.name: 8.2 Equity and redistribution of income and wealth
details: equity vs equality
equity vs efficiency
absolute vs relative poverty
the poverty trap
policies: negative income tax, universal/means-tested benefits, universal basic income

subtopics.name: 8.3 Labour market forces and government intervention
details: demand for labour as derived demand
factors affecting demand for labour
shifts and movements in demand curve for labour
marginal revenue product (MRP) theory: definition, calculation, and derivation of firm's demand
factors affecting supply of labour: wage and non-wage factors
shifts and movements in supply curve for labour
wage determination in perfect markets
wage determination in imperfect markets: trade unions, government (minimum wage), monopsony employers
wage differentials
transfer earnings and economic rent: definitions and factors

subtopics.name: 9.1 The circular flow of income
details: the multiplier process: definition, formulae/calculation, propensities (aps, mps, apc, mpc, apm, mpm), tax rates
components of AD and determinants: consumption, savings, investment, government spending, net exports
full employment level vs equilibrium: inflationary and deflationary gaps

subtopics.name: 9.2 Economic growth and sustainability
details: actual vs potential growth
output gaps (positive/negative)
business (trade) cycle: phases, causes, automatic stabilisers
policies for growth and effectiveness
inclusive growth: definition, impact on equity, and policies
sustainable growth: definition, resource conservation, environmental impact, and mitigation policies

subtopics.name: 9.3 Employment/unemployment
details: definition of full employment
equilibrium vs disequilibrium unemployment (hysteresis)
voluntary vs involuntary unemployment
natural rate of unemployment: definition, determinants, policy implications
patterns and trends
mobility of labour: geographical and occupational, factors affecting mobility
policies to reduce unemployment and effectiveness

subtopics.name: 9.4 Money and banking
details: money: definition, functions, characteristics
money supply definition
quantity theory of money (MV = PT)
commercial banks: deposit accounts, lending, holdings, ratios, objectives
changes in money supply: credit creation/multiplier, central bank role, deficit financing, quantitative easing
inflation policies and effectiveness
demand for money: liquidity preference theory
interest rate determination: loanable funds and Keynesian theory

subtopics.name: 10.1 Government macroeconomic policy objectives
details: objectives: inflation, balance of payments, unemployment, growth, development, sustainability, redistribution

subtopics.name: 10.2 Links between macroeconomic problems and their interrelatedness
details: internal vs external value of money
balance of payments and inflation
growth and inflation
growth and balance of payments
inflation and unemployment: Phillips curve (traditional and expectations-augmented)

subtopics.name: 10.3 Effectiveness of policy options to meet all macroeconomic objectives
details: effectiveness of fiscal (Laffer curve), monetary, supply-side, exchange rate, and trade policies
problems and conflicts arising from policies
government failure in macroeconomic policies

subtopics.name: 11.1 Policies to correct disequilibrium in the balance of payments
details: accounts: current, financial, and capital
effect of fiscal, monetary, supply-side, protectionist, and exchange rate policies
expenditure-switching vs expenditure-reducing policies

subtopics.name: 11.2 Exchange rates
details: measurement: nominal vs real, trade-weighted exchange rates
fixed and managed systems
revaluation vs devaluation
changes under different systems
effects on external economy: Marshall-Lerner and J curve analysis

subtopics.name: 11.3 Economic development
details: classification by development level
classification by national income
indicators of living standards: monetary, non-monetary, composite (HDI, MEW, MPI); Kuznets curve
comparison over time and between countries

subtopics.name: 11.4 Characteristics of countries at different levels of development
details: population: birth/death rates, infant mortality, migration, optimum population, urbanisation
income distribution: Gini coefficient and Lorenz curve
economic structure: sectors (primary, secondary, tertiary), patterns of trade

subtopics.name: 11.5 Relationship between countries at different levels of development
details: international aid: forms, reasons, and effects
trade and investment
multinational companies (MNCs): definition, activities, consequences
Foreign Direct Investment (FDI): definition and consequences
external debt: causes and consequences
role of IMF and World Bank

subtopics.name: 11.6 Globalisation
details: meaning, causes, and consequences
economic integration: free trade area, customs union, monetary union, full economic union
trade creation and trade diversion
